intro.mainTitle: Complete Guide to BIS Certification & CRS Registration in India

whatIsBIS.title: What is BIS Registration?
whatIsBIS.paragraph1: The Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) is the national standards body of India, functioning under the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food & Public Distribution, Government of India. Its core responsibility is to ensure that products in the Indian market conform to specific quality, safety, and performance standards outlined in the Indian Standards (IS).
whatIsBIS.paragraph2: One of the most important schemes governed by BIS is the Compulsory Registration Scheme (CRS) — a regulatory framework mandating product registration for certain categories, particularly electronic and IT goods.
whatIsBIS.paragraph3: BIS Certification provides a formal guarantee that the product complies with Indian safety and performance standards, which helps protect Indian consumers from unsafe or substandard products.

overview.title: What is CRS – Compulsory Registration Scheme?
overview.paragraph1: Launched in 2012, the Compulsory Registration Scheme (CRS) is a product registration scheme under BIS that initially targeted electronic goods. Over the years, it has expanded to include a wide array of product categories such as electrical appliances, solar equipment, batteries, and more CRS is mandatory for notified products through Quality Control Orders (QCOs) issued by various ministries.
overview.paragraph2: CRS Registration ensures that any product covered under the scheme must be registered with BIS before it is sold, imported, or distributed in India.

eligibility.title: Eligibility Criteria for BIS CRS Registration

whoCanApply.title: Who Can Apply for BIS Certification Under CRS?
whoCanApply.description: To obtain a BIS certificate under the Compulsory Registration Scheme (CRS), the applicant must meet specific eligibility requirements outlined by the Bureau of Indian Standards. These conditions ensure that only genuine manufacturers are permitted to register and label products with the BIS CRS logo.

manufacturer.description: Only the original manufacturer (not trader or reseller) of the product is eligible to apply.

location.requirement: Location Can Be Indian or Foreign
location.description: Both Indian manufacturers and international brands can apply.

air.description: Foreign manufacturers must appoint an AIR — either their Indian branch or a formally authorized third party.

testReports.description: The product must be tested at a BIS-recognized lab and meet the Indian Standard (IS) applicable.

documentation.description: All required documents must be submitted in prescribed formats (details in next section).

registration.description: A separate application must be filed for each product type, manufacturing location, and brand name.

air.title: Who is an Authorized Indian Representative (AIR)?
air.description: If you're a foreign manufacturer, BIS requires you to appoint an Authorized Indian Representative (AIR) as your official contact in India.

responsibilities.heading: AIR Responsibilities:
points: Acts as the legal representative of the foreign applicant
Handles all BIS communications and obligations on behalf of the manufacturer
Takes legal responsibility for compliance and documentation
Must not be a trader or reseller unless explicitly appointed by the manufacturer

air.agreement: The AIR must submit an agreement signed by both parties and must have an Indian address.
